text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response strongly advises taking the \u00a31.4 million settlement, explicitly stating that the defamation trial is too risky because the opposing counsel threatened to 'burn what is left of this company to the ground.' This directly addresses the core concern of the criterion: the certainty of the financial win versus the risk that the company will be insolvent and unable to pay a judgment, even if the client wins the defamation suit. The candidate answer emphasizes the guaranteed capital versus the abstract nature of the retraction and the high risk of litigation destroying the opponent's solvency.", "criterion_id": "ac971de0-8321-435a-92ac-27ae6de6c6b6"}
